data.title: What to do in Paris's 5th arrondissement? Ideas for outings and good addresses
data.meta_description: Paris's 5th arrondissement is a rendez-vous with the capital's history, taking us back in time to antiquity. We'll take you on a tour of the treasures and good addresses to be discovered on this side of the Latin Quarter, so you can make the most of it!
data.text:
Known as home to a large part of the Latin Quarter, the 5th arrondissement is a place steeped inhistory that takes us back in time to Lutetia, the Paris of Antiquity. From theGallo-Roman arena to the vestiges of the terms, you'll be amazed by the sometimes little-known monuments that take you back in time. The heart of the 5th arrondissement is also home to the Muse de Cluny, dedicated to the Middle Ages, a period of which the capital retains relatively few vestiges, as well as the famous Sorbonne University, not forgetting Panthon, once the highest vantage point in Paris. The only palace on the Left Bank, the Lutetia, is located not far from the Bon March, which awaits us in the 7tharrondissement.

In the 5th arrondissement, Parisians of all ages can go green by visiting the exotic garden of , the Grande Mosque de Paris, or by strolling through the iconic Jardin des Plantes, with its remarkable trees and the Museum d'Histoire Naturelle. For botany enthusiasts, don't miss Square Viviani , home to the oldest tree in Paris, with its superb view over the Seine and Notre-Dame.

The 5th arrondissement is also packed with iconic institutions, including historic restaurants and gourmet patisseries that are sure to delight the sweet tooth. It's also home to intimate, confidential hotels that recall the charm of a Paris of yesteryear.

Paris 2024 Olympics: the 2024 club at the Arnes de Lutce, a fan zone in an ancient amphitheatre

Imagine following the events of the Modern Olympic Games from a Gallo-Roman amphitheatre. For the Paris 2024 Olympics, a fanzone awaits us on the side of the Latin Quarter, in the heart of the Arnes de Lutce. Join us from July 26 to September 8, 2024, to enjoy the giant screen and entertainment from this ancient monument in the 5th arrondissement of Paris. [Read more]

The Lutetia Arena, a Gallo-Roman amphitheater in the heart of Paris

Did you know about the Arnes de Lutce? This well-preserved Gallo-Roman amphitheatre, located in the heart of the Arnes de Lutce square in Paris, is a true symbol of the Parisian art of living! [Read more]

The Galerie de Palontologie et d'Anatomie Compare, the Museum's nugget in the Jardin des Plantes

You've heard of the Musum and the Galerie de l'volution, but what about the Galerie de Palontologie et d'Anatomie compare, nestling at the entrance to the Jardin des Plantes on the Gare d'Austerlitz side? From living creatures to extinct dinosaurs, discover the world of bones in this sublime museum, well worth a visit. [Read more]

Discover the treasures of the Paris Musum National d'Histoire Naturelle - program

The Musum National d'Histoire Naturelle de Paris with its Jardin des Plantes is an emblematic institution of the capital, founded in 1793. Accessible all year round, this museum offers an insight into the world's rich natural heritage. From plants and magnets to fossils and experiments, immerse yourself in the fascinating world of nature. [Read more]

La Menagerie du Jardin des Plantes, the oldest zoo in Paris

The Menagerie, or rather the zoo of the Jardin des Plantes, belongs to the Musum national d'Histoire naturelle. Located next to the famous Jardin des Plantes, it's not only the oldest zoo in Paris, opened in 1794, it's also an area well worth a visit. Every day, hundreds of animals live in 5.5 hectares of greenery. Come and discover them! [Read more]

The Grande Galerie de l'Evolution, the immense museum dedicated to animals from all over the world, in Paris

If you've ever taken a stroll through the Jardin des Plantes in Paris, you'll no doubt have spotted the grand old buildings that stand along the way: this is the Museum of Natural History, of which the Grande Galerie de l'Evolution is a part. [Read more]

The Bibliothque Sainte-Genevive, in the heart of the Latin Quarter

The Bibliothque Sainte-Genevive is a landmark in the Latin Quarter. Discover its history! [Read more]

The Curie Museum: In the footsteps of Marie Curie and her family

At the heart of the Curie campus, in the 5th arrondissement of Paris near the Panthon, lies the Muse Curie. Open from Wednesday to Saturday, this free place of memory and knowledge offers an insight into the history of radioactivity and its medical applications. [Read more]

The Muse de la Sculpture en plein air: a free art walk in the heart of Paris

Have you heard of the Muse de la Sculpture en plein air? Located in the Square Tino Rossi in the 5th arrondissement, this small museum offers a free cultural stroll along the banks of the Seine, in a magnificent bucolic setting. [Read more]

Maison Poincar: we visited the very first mathematics museum in Paris

The Maison Poincar, nestled in the heart of Paris's Latin Quarter, invites you to discover the capital's very first mathematics museum from September 30, 2023. Inspired by the world's greatest science museums, this unique venue promises to illuminate the history, influence and wonders of mathematics for all the curious! We tell you all about it! [Read more]

Institut du Monde Arabe (IMA): program, exhibitions, events, everything you need to know about this cultural center

The Institut du Monde Arabe is an astonishing place where Arab culture reveals itself to us through astonishing exhibitions and an eclectic program of events for all ages and all audiences! [Read more]

The Muse de Cluny, Paris' museum of the Middle Ages, its program and age-old treasures

Located in the heart of the Latin Quarter, the Muse de Cluny is housed in the 13th-century Htel des Abbs de Cluny, and is home to works of art even older than that! Come and visit this museum dedicated to the Middle Ages in Paris. [Read more]

The Collge des Bernardins: one of the oldest medieval buildings in Paris to visit free of charge

Let's discover the Collge des Bernardins - one of the oldest medieval buildings in Paris. Be sure to visit this 13th-century gem, located in the heart of the Latin Quarter and open to the public free of charge. Open all year round, this cultural space offers a variety of exhibitions and events, and even a caf-restaurant. [Read more]

The Muse de la Prfecture de Police, immerse yourself in history and police investigations

The Muse de la Prfecture de Police, nestled in the heart of the 5th arrondissement, invites visitors on a fascinating exploration of the history of the Paris police force from the 17th century to the present day. Available all year round, this historic treasure trove on rue de la Montagne Sainte-Genevive unveils over 2,000 authentic and captivating works of art. [Read more]

The Jardin des Plantes' hidden Alpine garden, a nugget worth discovering

The Jardin des Plantes conceals a magnificent alpine garden. Located between the Grandes Serres and the Menagerie, this garden, which has no entrance doors, is accessible via a hidden underground passage. Here you can discover the rock gardens and wild mountain plants. It's a haven of peace to be (re)discovered all year round. [Read more]

Le Clos des Arnes, hidden vineyards in the heart of the Arnes de Lutce in Paris

In the 6th arrondissement, the Arnes de Lutce is one of those suspended places that still retains all its charm from ancient times. This is where you'll find some of the rarest vines in Paris, to be discovered adorned with beautiful bunches of grapes as the harvest season approaches. [Read more]

The Jardin des Plantes rose garden unveils its beautiful colors

The Roseraie du Jardin des Plantes, located along the Galerie de Minralogie, to the right of the Musum national d'Histoire naturelle or to the left if you're coming from the Seine, is a wonderful place to discover in spring and especially in June. With its 390 species of old and modern roses, it's a magnificent and free rose garden, in addition to the superb rosebushes that stand proudly in front of the Musum. [Read more]

The Sorbonne Library, in the 5th arrondissement

If you're still a student, then you have the chance to visit the Bibliothque de la Sorbonne, in the 5th arrondissement. A wonderful place to study in peace and quiet. [Read more]

Saint-Sverin Church, in the Latin Quarter

The Eglise Saint-Sverin, in the heart of the Latin Quarter, is a fine example of Gothic architecture that takes us back to medieval Paris. [Read more]

The Church of Saint-Etienne-du-Mont, a stone's throw from the Pantheon

The Eglise Saint-Etienne-du-Mont houses the remains of Sainte-Genevive, the patron saint of Paris, as well as a little marvel rarely seen elsewhere that will delight connoisseurs. [Read more]

The Institut Finlandais in Paris: an open window on Finnish culture and society

Located in the heart of Paris's Latin Quarter, the Institut Finlandais is a genuine invitation to travel and discover the beautiful and discreet Nordic country of Finland. Throughout the year, this multi-disciplinary cultural center offers a rich and varied program combining gastronomy, design and visual arts! [Read more]

Etienne Dinet, Algerian passions: the exhibition that takes us on a journey is extended at the IMA

Discover Etienne Dinet and his Algerian passions, in an exhibition organized from January 30 to September 15, 2024 at the Institut du Monde Arabe, Paris. [Read more]

Discover the treasures of the Jardin des Plantes in Paris

Paris's Jardin des Plantes is home to a number of historical and unusual sights that are well worth a visit. We reveal 8 treasures to discover in this 24-hectare haven of peace, one of the most beautiful parks in Paris. [Read more]

Arabofuturs: an exhibition of science fiction and predictions at the Institut du Monde Arabe - photos

Artists from the Arab world imagine the worlds of tomorrow, in an exhibition between science fiction and dreams. Discover Arabofuturs at the Institut du Monde Arabe from April 23 to October 27, 2024. [Read more]

Histoires paralympiques: a tribute exhibition at the Panthon this summer

The Pantheon tells us the Paralympic Stories, from sporting integration to social inclusion, in an exhibition organized from June 11 to September 29, 2024. [Read more]

Center culturel irlandais: the institution that promotes Irish culture in Paris

Exhibitions, concerts, screenings, debates... Throughout the year, the Centre culturel irlandais opens its doors to all for a cultural immersion on the Emerald Isle. Let's take a closer look at this cultural institution, housed since 2002 in the Collge des Irlandais building in the heart of Paris's Latin Quarter. [Read more]

Baghdad exhibition with Assassin's Creed Mirage at the Institut du Monde Arabe - our photos

When video games allow us to explore the past... The Institut du Monde Arabe and Ubisoft join forces for an exceptional exhibition: February 28 to November 10, 2024, discover Baghdad: rediscover Madinat al-Salam, with Assassin's Creed Mirage. [Read more]

The Pantheon in Paris: prices, opening hours, tour and history of this emblematic monument

The Paris Pantheon, an emblematic monument in the heart of the capital, reveals the history of France's great personalities. Originally a church dedicated to Sainte Genevive, the Panthon is open all year round, giving you the chance to discover its rich heritage and architectural secrets. [Read more]

Missak Manouchian exhibition at the Panthon

The Panthon is hosting an exhibition entitled "Vivre  en mourir. Missak Manouchian et ses camarades de Rsistance au Panthon" (Living to Die. Missak Manouchian and his Comrades in the Resistance at the Pantheon), on view at no extra charge until September 8, 2024. [Read more]

Wonderful Treasure of Oignies: discover one of Belgium's 7 wonders at the Muse de Cluny

An exceptional historical treasure, presented for the first time in France for a century: don't miss the Merveilleux Trsor d'Oignies exhibition at the Muse de Cluny, on view from March 19 to October 20, 2024. [Read more]

Police and sport: esprit de corps, culture du corps: the Prfecture de Police museum exhibition

From March 7 to September 22, 2024, the Muse de la Prfecture de Police presents "Police et sport: esprit de corps, culture du corps", a free exhibition focusing on sporting practices. [Read more]

Did you know? You can watch the Earth rotate thanks to Foucault's pendulum in Paris.

Want to see the Earth spinning at the end of a wire? You're in luck, because two of Foucault's pendulums can be seen in Paris, in the heart of the Panthon and the Muse des Arts et Mtiers. [Read more]

Did you know? Discover France's oldest cedar of Lebanon in Paris and its unusual history.

In the heart of Paris, the Jardin des Plantes is home to a historical curiosity: the oldest cedar of Lebanon in France. Planted in 1734, its history is a mixture of botany, legend and an incredible journey. Let's take a green walk through Buffon's labyrinth to discover this remarkable 300-year-old tree. [Read more]

Did you know? The Gloriette de Buffon is the oldest metal structure in Paris.

In the heart of Paris's 5th arrondissement, the Jardin des Plantes is home to the mysterious and historic Gloriette de Buffon, dating from 1786. Discover a hidden treasure. [Read more]

To be read

Amusement parks and funfairs in and around Paris, 2024 program

The Durfort Mammoth at the Paris Natural History Museum, restored!

(Re)discover at the Musum national d'Histoire naturelle, Paris, the newly restored "Mammouth de Durfort", an icon of paleontology on display since 1898. [Read more]

Meteorites from a French asteroid on display at the Musum national d'histoire naturelle

In February 2023, an asteroid fell in Normandy. And many people collected these little meteorites to enable science to analyze them! Today, they can be seen at the Musum national d'histoire naturelle in Paris! [Read more]

Where to eat in the 5th arrondissement?

Restaurants in Paris's 5th arrondissement: Where to eat in the district? Our best addresses

If you're looking for the perfect restaurant in Paris' 5th arrondissement, you've come to the right place! Follow the guide to discover our best addresses, our latest discoveries and our favorites! [Read more]

Caf Maa: Finnish gastronomy in the heart of Paris

Do you know Caf Maa? Nestled on the first floor of the Institut Finlandais, in the heart of Paris's 5th arrondissement, this ultra-gourmand, convivial venue puts Finnish cuisine in the spotlight with traditional Nordic recipes revisited by chef Alexandra Marschan-Claude. [Read more]

Brunch at Caf Clotilde by Nina Mtayer: the gourmet rendezvous on Paris's Left Bank

Looking for a tasty brunch on the Left Bank? Head for Caf Clotilde, tucked away in the beautiful Maison Colbert hotel, to enjoy this ultra gourmet moment every Sunday, where Nina Mtayer's pastries are the talk of Paris. [Read more]

Le Bon Moment: lively coffeeshop and friendly coworking space in the Latin Quarter

Rue des Bernardins, a stone's throw from the Pont de l'Archevch (linking the Latin Quarter to the le de la Cit), nestles a coffeeshop where you can come all day long. Simple, friendly or family-friendly (if you prefer), it's a little bubble of tranquillity where you can enjoy lunch, a snack or one of the excellent specialty coffees served hot or fresh. [Read more]

Le goter de Clotilde, a regressive and gourmet tea time by Nina Mtayer

In the 5th arrondissement, the Maison Colbert hotel is now serving a brand new tea time, imagined by Nina Mtayer, voted best pastry chef in the world in 2023. A blend of childhood flavors and gourmet patisserie, Le goter de Clotilde offers a gourmet experience to share with friends and family. [Read more]

Le Renard Caf, the bookshop-cafe dedicated to Japanese culture in Paris

A few steps away from the Renard Dor bookstore, in the 5th arrondissement of Paris, the Renard Caf has opened, highlighting Japanese culture, between mangas, bubble tea and quality pastries. [Read more]

Shakespeare and Company, the most English-speaking bookstore in Paris

Opposite Notre-Dame de Paris, the Shakespeare and Company Caf adjoins the historic English-language bookstore founded by George Whitman. Gourmets and literary souls, you have found your paradise! [Read more]

Carl Marletti, the unmissable pastry shop in the Latin Quarter

Among the pastry shops of famous chefs, Carl Marletti's is a real favorite! This gourmet address located in the Latin Quarter delights sweet tooths with original desserts, original creations and revisited classics. [Read more]

Odette Paris, the house of cream puffs with old-fashioned charm

If you love cream puffs, Odette is the gourmet pastry shop that will make you happy. With two charming addresses with a retro spirit, this spot delights Parisians with freshly prepared choux every day. [Read more]

Les Belles Envies, the sugar-free pastry and chocolate shop

Les Belles Envies is the new sugar-free patisserie that opened on rue Monge in the 5th arrondissement. A low glycemic index pastry shop offering cakes, chocolates and delicatessen. An ideal option for diabetics, those concerned about their figure or their health. How about a treat for yourself? [Read more]

Le Tremblement de Terre: the seismic escape game at The Game

Escape game fans, mark your calendars! The Game, an establishment of the genre located near the Pantheon, has been offering its most vibrant escape game, Le Tremblement de Terre, since January 14, 2020. A new room in a brand-new space on rue de la Harpe, in the heart of Saint-Michel. [Read more]

The Wild West: our test of The Game's powder-scented escape game

Western and escape game fans are invited to The Game - Saint-Michel, in Paris's 5th arrondissement, to discover one of the establishment's most immersive rooms, the Far West. We've tried it, and we'll tell you all about it! [Read more]

Visit the ancient Thermes de Lutce and their underground galleries in Paris

Did you know? In Paris, you can immerse yourself in antiquity with a visit to the Roman baths in what was once northern Lutetia. Visit the Muse de Cluny to discover these ancient baths during weekend tours. [Read more]

La Mission Spatiale: an interstellar escape game in Armageddon mode at The Game

The Game, an escape game near Jussieu, invites budding astronauts to discover a brand new room. Entitled The Space Mission, it plunges you into a disaster scenario worthy of the film Armageddon. [Read more]

Escape Game Awards 2023: The Game, an immersive escape game just a stone's throw from Jussieu

Looking for a Team Building event? Celebrating your child's birthday? Want to strengthen your ties with your friends? That's what The Game, one of Paris's leading escape game operators, has to offer. A whole series of immersive rooms with a special emphasis on teamwork. And the icing on the cake: the establishment won the Best Brand Award at the Escape Game Awards 2023... A good reason to come and try out their rooms! [Read more]

The Pontoise swimming pool, this Art Deco jewel in Paris has reopened: prices, activities and squash

The legendary Pontoise swimming pool, an Art Deco jewel listed as a Monument Historique, reopened its doors in early December 2023 after extensive renovation work. Located at 19, rue Pontoise in the 5th arrondissement of Paris, this historic swimming pool, designed by the same architect as Molitor and Pailleron, invites you to discover its unique architecture and new facilities. Fitness, weight training and squash await you. [Read more]

Storm Cycling Club: the training center, coffeeshop and boutique for cycling enthusiasts

In the Saint-Victor district of Paris, the Storm Cycling Club brings together cycling enthusiasts in a multifunctional space, perfect for preparing or equipping them. [Read more]

Unusual: witness the feeding of the felines at the Jardin des Plantes Menagerie

On certain days of the week, the Jardin des Plantes Menagerie invites you to take part in an exceptional experience in the fauverie, in the heart of the Jardin des Plantes Menagerie, by attending a feline meal. [Read more]

Escape Game Awards 2023: Le Mtro at The Game takes the prize in Ile-de-France - our test

The Game invites escape game fans to discover one of the most unusual rooms, Le Mtro, at its two locations in Cardinal Lemoine and Saint-Michel, in Paris's 5th arrondissement. What makes it special? A real RATP metro carriage. The room won first prize in the Ile-de-France region at the Escape Game Awards 2023. Ready for an underground adventure? [Read more]

Discover the unusual Lion Fountain in the Jardin des Plantes : History and curiosities

Do you know the Lion Fountain in the Jardin des Plantes? Located near the entrance on rue Geoffroy Saint Hilaire, this work of art dating from 1863 awaits you at the foot of Buffon's labyrinth. We tell you all about it. [Read more]

La Mission Secrte: our test of The Game's most secret escape game in Paris

Escape game fans, here's something to surprise you! The Game, an escape game store in the heart of Paris, offers you a new kind of experience - so to speak - with its new room... Entitled "La Mission Secrte" (The Secret Mission), it invites you to discover it without knowing anything about it beforehand! No theme, no information about the mission... That's the big surprise. We've tested it, and we'll tell you all about it (spoiler-free)! [Read more]

Bowling Mouffetard, the bowling and billiards complex in the 5th arrondissement

Are you in the 5th arrondissement and looking for a fun activity to do with family and friends? If you're a bowling fan, the choice is obvious: head for Bowling Mouffetard, located on rue Mouffetard, as its name suggests, and offering eight lanes for strike after strike, as well as pool tables and arcade terminals. [Read more]

Survive aboard the plane from The Game, the immersive escape game!

The Game, the immersive escape game that's one of the industry leaders in France, is offering a brand new room in its Paris premises, l'Avion, open since July 26, 2017. Do you dare to climb aboard? [Read more]

Casino heist: The Game's iconic escape game

The Game, one of the leading escape game establishments in Paris, has just renovated one of its most iconic rooms, Braquage au Casino. The heist of the century is now available! [Read more]

The Haunted Cinema, The Game's horrific escape game

Fancy a scare at the movies? As cinemas reopen on May 19, The Game, the capital's escape game brand, has decided to celebrate cinema in its own way with its brand new horrific room based around the 7th art, to be discovered as soon as the establishment reopens on June 9, 2021. [Read more]

Bank robbery at The Game, the immersive escape game!

Escape game fans, we've discovered The Game, an escape game located in the Jussieu district, which doesn't take the game lightly. Here, you have to rob a bank in less than an hour. So, are you up for the challenge? [Read more]

The Long Hop: an English pub not to be missed in Paris

Located in the 5th arrondissement, The Long Hop is a lively, friendly English pub in the heart of Paris, ideal for sports fans and beer lovers. [Read more]

The Bombardier: the English bar a stone's throw from the Pantheon

An English pub located next to the Pantheon, The Bombardier is a must in the 5th arrondissement for a good beer or to watch a match with atmosphere! [Read more]

Le Nouvel Institut: the cheap, festive and sporty bar in Paris's 5th arrondissement

A well-known bar in Paris's 5th arrondissement, the Nouvel Institut is the inexpensive place to sit out on the terrace, watch a match or play a game of billiards in the evening! [Read more]

Le Toit de la Tour, the new rooftop terrace at the Tour d'Argent

Le Toit de la Tour is the name of the new rooftop at the Tour d'Argent, which is set to enchant our Parisian summer. With a terrace overlooking the capital's rooftops, a cocktail bar and champagne, you'll love having your afterworks there. [Read more]

Hotel Pilgrim's rooftop terrace for relaxing over the rooftops of Paris

Looking for a beautiful rooftop terrace, as if you were sitting on the rooftops of Paris? Then head for Htel Pilgrim, where you'll find a confidential terrace where you can relax in the evenings on sunny days, while admiring the whole of Paris and the Collge des Bernardins building just opposite. [Read more]

The 3615 croisire, the old school barge with dancefloor, returns to Paris this spring-summer 2024

Le 3615, the old-school bar that takes us back to the 80s to 2009, is back this summer with an unusual cruise that's sure to bring back fond memories. The program includes arcade terminals, a dancefloor, karaoke, cocktails and goodies, all to the rhythm of the hits that have marked us. See you every Friday from May 24 to mid-October 2024! [Read more]

Solera, the craziest cocktail bar in Paris

Solera is the crazy cocktail bar on the Left Bank. Here you'll discover a stunning menu of spectacular signature creations. The perfect place for an unusual cocktail experience! [Read more]

Le P'tit Louis: the chic, relaxed wine bar in Paris's 5th arrondissement

"Wine & dinette" is the motto of P'tit Louis, Bertrand Guillou-Valentin's new Parisian venue. Nestled in the capital's 5th arrondissement, this wine bar offers no fewer than 500 references, complemented by a menu designed by Mlanie Serre and featuring tasty plates for sharing. [Read more]

The Orchestre de chambre de Paris in a special concert at the Panthon

Classical music invites itself to the Panthon! As part of the Cultural Olympiad - Paralympic Games, the sublime Parisian monument in the 5th arrondissement is opening its doors to the Orchestre de chambre de Paris, which is offering two exceptional concerts scheduled for Saturday, September 7, 2024. [Read more]

Anatole the magician returns with his interactive magic show: Anatole tells you about magic

An increasingly well-known magician in Paris, Anatole is back with his show Anatole vous raconte la magie at the Comdie Saint-Michel. In his interactive show, he introduces audiences to the history of magic through the centuries, and its different practices. [Read more]

Lou Trotignon at La Nouvelle Seine with his show Mrou

Stand-up comedian Lou Trotignon takes to the Nouvelle Seine stage with his show Mrou, every Friday and Saturday at 9pm from September 13, 2024 to December 21. [Read more]

Le Son de la Terre : a barge dedicated to Jazz and World Music on the Seine in Paris

This spring, a new musical and gourmet barge is mooring in Paris. Le Son de la Terre, as it is called, awaits music lovers, jazz and world music enthusiasts, in the 5th arrondissement to offer them a unique experience combining concerts, bistronomic table and cocktail bar. [Read more]

What to do around Saint-Michel, the Pantheon and the Latin Quarter: Our tips and best addresses

Why not take a stroll around the Latin Quarter, the Pantheon and Saint-Michel? Here you'll find the best tips and addresses in the area! [Read more]
